title: You've probably already heard this question
body:
So as the title mentions, you've probably heard and answered this question a million times. But I've seen mixed results from both players and Rioters, so for the sake of my sanity, could I get a Rioter to answer this one more time.

Are custom skins (I'd be using wooxy) safe to use. I'm mostly concerned about getting banned. Do custom skins, specifically installed by wooxy, breach the terms of service? Can I be banned even if I was under the assumption I was immune? 

I haven't downloaded it yet, I'm waiting to be 100% sure because I don't want to lose an account with 5 years of work and money thrown in.

replies.body:
Officially, Riot's stance on custom skin models sits in a firm "use-at-your-own-risk" state. Essentially, there are a wide variety of reasons why custom skins could hurt your system. Custom skins run the risk of not being optimized, which could hurt your gameplay performance and could also come attached with malicious software like keyloggers which could compromise your account security. 

Make sure to read over this [**Third Party Program FAQ**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/225266848) before downloading anything that might have the potential you hurt your system.
